comments: Every negabinary numbral appears infinitely often (since every signed integer can be represented as a sum of two signed integers in infinitely many ways).
references: A. Frosini and S. Rinaldi, On the Sequence A079500 and Its Combinatorial Interpretations, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 9 (2006), Article 06.3.1.
example: a(4)=6 since a(4) corresponds to the table entry for [1]+[1]=1+1=2=4-2=[6]
author: _Marc LeBrun_, Sep 25 2000
